comments: a(n) is the number of ways to select a subset of {1,2,...n} and then use the subset as an alphabet to form ordered triples.
references: A. P. Prudnikov, Yu. A. Brychkov and O.I. Marichev, "Integrals and Series", Volume 1: "Elementary Functions", Chapter 4: "Finite Sums", New York, Gordon and Breach Science Publishers, 1986-1992.
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (8,-24,32,-16).
formula: a(n) = Sum(i^3 * binomial(n, i), i=0..n): binomial transform of A000578.G.f.: x*(1+2*x-2*x^2)/(1-2*x)^4. E.g.f.: x*(1+3*x+x^2)*e^(2*x).
author: Yong Kong (ykong(AT)curagen.com), Dec 26 2000
